definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
mark/sign/talisman/to seal/to correspond to/tally/symbol/written charm/to coincide
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: Punctuation marks are an integrant sign of cohesion and coherence in modern writing.
sentences.chinese: 标点符号是现代书面语中不可缺少的衔接和连贯标志。

sentences.english: Be consistent in grammar or punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 在文笔和标点符号上保持一致。

sentences.english: And I sigh with my punctuations.
Our teacher is very fussy about punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 我们老师对标点符号十分挑剔。

sentences.english: Do not append or prepend a digit or punctuation mark to a word.
sentences.chinese: 不要附加或预先准备一个数字或标点符号的一个字。

sentences.english: As English is characterized by hypotaxis, its syntax is closely bound up with punctuation as well as other typographical devices.
sentences.chinese: 英语属于形合语言，标点符号与句法结构关系密切。

sentences.english: I always forget to add the punctuation at the end of a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 我总是忘记在句末加上标点符号。

sentences.english: The pupils have not yet learned to punctuate correctly.
sentences.chinese: 小学生尚未学会正确使用标点符号。

sentences.english: Punctuation symbols must be recognized and properly interpreted.
sentences.chinese: 必须正确认识和理解标点符号。

sentences.english: Comma is a kind of punctuation.
I read your sentence and it'll kill me, cause you haven't write any interpunction .
sentences.chinese: 我念了你的话，因为没有标点符号，害得我差点断气。

sentences.english: By convention, the ten most commonly used punctuations are identified below.
sentences.chinese: 以下是十个惯用的标点符号。

sentences.english: M: I always forget to add the punctuation at the end of a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 我总是忘记在句末加上标点符号。

sentences.english: English text is edited for spelling and punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 英文版本在拼写和标点符号上作了一定修改。

sentences.english: Headings don’t generally include periods or other ending punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 标题一般不包括圆点或其它结束语句标点符号。
完美的语法，结构和标点符号。

definition: to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
blank/blank space on a form/space/囗 (indicating missing or illegible character)
Chinese back-sloping comma 、 (punct. used to separate items in a list)
